intro: Pappophorum cenchroides, commonly known as the coastal panicgrass, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the southeastern United States. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in sandy or disturbed soils along the shoreline. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny flowers, which are wind-pollinated. Its leaves are narrow and坚韧, adapted to withstand salt spray and strong coastal winds. Pappophorum cenchroides plays a role in stabilizing dunes and providing habitat for coastal wildlife.
